<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 118, 379, 142]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge IGCSE™  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 170, 183, 187]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 194, 332, 210]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Multiple Choice (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 246, 507, 262]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 277, 437, 285]]<|/det|>
You will need: Multiple choice answer sheet  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[215, 286, 539, 317]]<|/det|>
Soft clean eraser Soft pencil (type B or HB is recommended)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 337, 228, 352]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 354, 133, 368]]<|/det|>
<label>+</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 351, 112, 368]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[129, 354, 599, 369]]<|/det|>
There are forty questions on this paper. Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 369, 907, 400]]<|/det|>
For each question there are four possible answers A, B, C and D. Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 400, 579, 415]]<|/det|>
Follow the instructions on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 416, 277, 430]]<|/det|>
Write in soft pencil.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 431, 868, 461]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number on the multiple choice answer sheet in the spaces provided unless this has been done for you.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 462, 327, 476]]<|/det|>
Do not use correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 477, 364, 492]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 493, 329, 507]]<|/det|>
You may use a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 508, 680, 523]]<|/det|>
Take the weight of \(1.0\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(9.8\mathrm{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 9.8\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 550, 220, 564]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 566, 360, 581]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 40.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 582, 443, 597]]<|/det|>
Each correct answer will score one mark.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 598, 569, 613]]<|/det|>
Any rough working should be done on this question paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 657, 789, 676]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 687, 603, 705]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 715, 134, 734]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 743, 134, 761]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 743, 527, 761]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 769, 520, 787]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 97, 88]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 792, 89]]<|/det|> Two identical containers, P and Q, are partly filled with different quantities of sand. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 102, 672, 119]]<|/det|> The position of the centre of gravity for each container is labelled X. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[344, 128, 655, 225]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 238, 747, 255]]<|/det|> Which container is more stable and what is the reason why it is more stable? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 266, 134, 284]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 266, 620, 284]]<|/det|> P is more stable because it has a lower centre of gravity. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 293, 134, 310]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 293, 546, 310]]<|/det|> P is more stable because it has a smaller mass. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 319, 134, 337]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 319, 616, 337]]<|/det|> Q is more stable because it has a greater depth of sand. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 345, 134, 364]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 345, 628, 364]]<|/det|> Q is more stable because it has a higher centre of gravity. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 389, 96, 407]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 388, 658, 407]]<|/det|> The diagram shows a steel sphere falling through a cylinder of oil. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[396, 415, 601, 579]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 588, 920, 622]]<|/det|> Which row indicates what happens to the steel sphere and what happens to the oil as the steel sphere falls? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 632, 473, 797]]<|/det|>
the steel sphere becomes warmerthe oil becomes warmer
Ayesyes
Byesno
Cnoyes
Dnono

All the sculptures are of equal weight and volume. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 546, 541, 564]]<|/det|> Which sculpture is least likely to sink into the sand? <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[247, 572, 747, 680]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 710, 106, 728]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 710, 621, 728]]<|/det|> A quantity of water is boiled to form the same mass of steam. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 740, 677, 758]]<|/det|> Which row shows how the volume and density of the water change? <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 769, 447, 900]]<|/det|>

statement 1statement 2
